Word or phrase: A man/woman by the name of

Replacement: enough, plenty, a lot (or say how many)
tell, say (unless you are giving advice)
add, write, fasten, stick on, fix to

Word or phrase: Arrangements are in the hands of

Replacement: come to, go to, be at
right, power, may (as in 'have the authority to')

Word or phrase: call your attention to the fact that

Replacement: equally OR as (one or the other, not both)
because of his or her position

Word or phrase: From the point of view of
his story is a strange one
I was unaware of the fact that
Replacement: I was unaware that, I did not know that
as under, in line with, because of

Word or phrase: In recognition of the fact that
in spite of the fact that
In spite of the fact that
In the case of/in terms of
in view of the fact that
In view of the fact that
It is often the case that
On account of the fact that

Replacement: plenty, too many (or say how many)
under, because of, in line with
think again about, look again at

Word or phrase: So far as x is concerned
Special ceremonies marking the event were held
the fact that he had not succeeded
the fact that I had arrived
there is no doubt but that
x o'clock A.M. in the morning
Replacement: x o'clock A.M. (ditto for "P.M. in the evening")
